image.altText: boxing glove

props.synopsis: Some parents say they saw an almost immediate improvement in their children's self-confidence after starting martial arts. But it's not about using violence to address violence.

title.children: Frustrated with bullying, these parents enrolled their kids in self-defence

image.altText: David speaks into a microphone as supporters' signs wave behind him and a guy holds a guitar.

props.synopsis: Former military lawyer David McBride challenges his jail sentence for distributing classified material to journalists over a ruling he says deprived him of a defence.

title.children: Jailed whistleblower David McBride appeals conviction

image.altText: Wild horses grazing in an alpine area.

props.synopsis: NSW Environment Minister Penny Sharpe has indicated that the wild horse management program at Kosciuszko National Park is ahead of schedule and that between 3,000 and 4,000 animals remain.

title.children: Brumby numbers 'way down' in Kosciuszko, aerial shooting paused

image.altText: A 10-year-old boy in a Ferrari cap stands on a karting track with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: While other Year 5 students are playing football or reading a book, Canberran Lazarus AÃ±onuevo is turning heads on go-karting circuits around Australia and overseas in his pursuit to become a Formula One driver.

title.children: Canberra go-karting prodigy making Formula One dream a reality

image.altText: A man smiles for the camera

props.synopsis: Nicole Williams pleaded guilty to attempted aggravated burglary and accessory after the fact to murder for her involvement in the death of Glenn Walewicz, and was today sentenced to seven years in jail.

title.children: It was a killing that baffled police. Now its mastermind has been jailed

image.altText: A fishing boat listing on the ocean after crashing into rocks.

props.synopsis: Beaches at a popular New South Wales Far South Coast tourist town have become littered with debris after a commercial fishing vessel ran aground this week.

title.children: Idyllic beaches littered with debris and diesel from NSW shipwreck

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell plays a shot against England at the Champions Trophy.

props.synopsis: Cricket Australia "postponed" its 2021 Test match with Afghanistan over concerns about the Taliban's human rights abuses against women, and did not play in the subsequent 2023 or 2024 series, but says it will fulfil its ICC Champions Trophy tournament obligations.

title.children: Australian cricket team play Afghanistan despite boycotting other matches

image.altText: Three women look at the camera.

props.synopsis: Not sure what to pack for your baby during a disaster? The Australian Breastfeeding Association has prepared a guide.

title.children: Mum rues leaving baby essentials behind in bushfire evacuation 'mad rush'

image.altText: Three men sit and talk, two hold up hands to a man in all black.

props.synopsis: The spectacular theatre of the Trump-Zelenskyy confrontation is yet another reminder of the way Trump has up-ended most of the comfortable assumptions which have buttressed Australia's security for decades.

title.children: How the Trump and Zelenskyy clash could have repercussions for Australia

image.altText: lady talking to reporters in corridor, in front of a microphone, holding glasses

props.synopsis: The Coalition unveils plans to force public servants to work from the office five days a week if it wins the next election. Follow live.Â

title.children: Coalition vows to force public servants back to the office

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Labor has no plans to index income tax brackets to inflation
Dutton's WFH push 'stolen' from the US: Gallagher
PM didn't mislead on Chinese warships: Marles

image.altText: A retail worker wearing an Ikea yellow high-vis t-shirt stands near shelves of goods holding a small device

props.synopsis: Retail employers argue staff should have the option to condense a full time week into four days, but some union officials say it's a ploy to have staff work longer hours and avoid overtime pay.

title.children: Four-day work week now a reality for some retail workers

image.altText: leaders of european countries stand for a group photo on stairs with their flags in a row behind

props.synopsis: Multiple countries are joining forward to write a peace plan to present to US President Donald Trump, a vital step to deter Russia.

title.children: A 'coalition of the willing' will write a peace plan to save Ukraine

image.altText: A truck arriving into Rafah carrying pallets of food and aid.

props.synopsis: Hamas accuses Israel of sending the Gaza ceasefire process back to "square one", rejecting calls to extend the current temporary truce and demanding negotiations on a lasting peace begin immediately.Â

title.children: Hamas accuses Israel of sending Gaza peace process back to 'square one'

image.altText: An old man wearing a white cassock with a green band sits with his arms crossed. He has a serious look on his face

props.synopsis: Pope Francis suffers two episodes of "acute respiratory insufficiency" and required Â "non-invasive" ventilation, the Vatican says.

title.children: Pope suffers setback with two episodes of 'respiratory insufficiency'

image.altText: Brittney Carroll GSK 3

props.synopsis: New data shows Australia's gender pay gap has narrowed, but working women are still more than $28,000 a year worse off than the average man.

title.children: How Australia's biggest companies stack up on gender pay equality

image.altText: An unidentifiable girl with pigtails in a classroom.

props.synopsis: New South Wales has become the latest state to sign an education funding deal with the federal government, meaning most of the country's public schools will now be on track to achieve the minimum funding levels recommended by the Gonski review in 2012.

title.children: Public schools to get billions more in funding after 'massive' deal struck with NSW

image.altText: An aircraft with two lights on the front and one at the back hovers in the night sky

props.synopsis: Experts say it's likely the drone was collecting information for the Chinese navy to use, but the country's foreign minister isn't happy.

title.children: Drone spotted near Australia-PNG border suspected to be from Chinese navy

image.altText: A group of police talking and walking through the streets of Mannheim, with police vehicles parked in a line.

props.synopsis: Police say a black SUV drove at high speed into a group of people in the German city of Mannheim.

title.children: Two dead, driver arrested after car drives into crowd in German city

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A woman looks in the mirror while holding her hair back.

props.synopsis: Behind the blood and guts, The Substance carried a viscously important message about how society treats women as they age. Its breakthrough at the Oscars is a landmark moment for women in horror.

title.children: The first body horror nominated for Best Picture is a triumph for women

image.altText: A man in a black jumper and another man in a blue suit and red tie speak and gesture to each other

props.synopsis: Sweden's former prime minister Carl Bildt has accused Russia of working with the US to undermine Ukraine's position.

title.children: 'Worst moment': Former Swedish PM hits out at Trump over weakening transatlantic alliance

image.altText: Several people in white medical care lean down to place numbers down at the scene of the attack,

props.synopsis: One man has been killed and another four people have been injured in a suspected stabbing attack in Haifa, northern Israel.

title.children: One killed, four injured in suspected stabbing attack in Haifa, Israel

image.altText: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents detain a man

props.synopsis: Dawn raids and the threat of being arrested at work spread anxiety among unauthorised migrants in the United States, including more than 1.3 million people from Asia.

title.children: Asians in the US report being 'picked up' due to physical appearance

props.synopsis: Elon Musk is following the "playbook" of Rupert Murdoch in influencing American politics, Silicon Valley insider Kara Swisher tells the ABC's Q+A. And she's worried he could choke Australia's internet access.

title.children: Australia urged to be wary of Musk and reassess relationship with America

image.altText: SpaceX Starship launching off the launch pad with a ball of fire sending up smoke

props.synopsis: It will be the eighth test flight of the powerful deep-space rocket that is hoped will eventually send humans to the Moon and Mars.

title.children: SpaceX receive the all clear to launch Starship's eighth test flight

image.altText: Friedrich Merz at an indoors press conference with the CDU political party logo over his shoulder.

props.synopsis: Friedrich Merz, who is likely to be the next German chancellor, has been outspoken in his belief Europe needs to pursue greater independence from the US.

title.children: Incoming German leader says Trump and Zelenskyy clash 'manufactured escalation'

image.altText: Drone shot of a steelworks factory and piles of coal

props.synopsis: The Whyalla steelworks lost nearly $320 million in the seven months before it was tipped into administration by the South Australian government, with administrators airing concerns about maintenance and safety at the industrial plant.

title.children: 'Relying on luck for safety': Whyalla steelworks losing $1.5m a day before administration

image.altText: Jim McDowell speaks with two women. An image of a ship is behind them.

props.synopsis: Jim McDowell, the Deputy Secretary Naval Shipbuilding and Sustainment, will leave his powerful position next month after warning of delays to selecting a winning design for the General Purpose Frigate fleet.

title.children: Senior defence official quits amid tension over $10 billion warship project

image.altText: An older couple hug as they admire a beach view

props.synopsis: Baby boomers are set to bequeath trillions to younger generations in the coming years. It raises ethical questions not just for recipients, but the people leaving wealth behind.

title.children: 'Sitting around waiting for you to die': The ethics of inheritance

image.altText: A woman in a broad brim hat stands on a street in front of a large Victorian building like a town hall with turret.

props.synopsis:
Ballarat council has allegedly stripped an environmental group of a $285,000 grant following claims of antisemitism levelled at a former board member by a climate-change-denying councillor.Â 

Â

title.children: Environmental group loses funding after alleged antisemitism claims

image.altText: Port Augusta courts building

props.synopsis: A South Australian judge says the Department for Child Protection failed to remove a child who was being criminally neglected by her mother despite observing the toddler in "urine-soaked" clothing.

title.children: Mother sentenced after leaving toddler in dirty nappy for days

image.altText: A small brown marsupial with a pointy nose and white spots on its brown fur looking at a camera

props.synopsis: An ambitious conservation effort to boost declining eastern quoll populations in Tasmania is underway, with 24 of the animals released onto a 5,000 hectare property.

title.children: Endangered eastern quolls released into wild in Tasmanian conservation project

image.altText: Kalinda Robinson smiles in sunglasses and a bike helmet

props.synopsis: Out of more than 5,000 applications, 21-year-old Australian cyclist Kalinda Robinson was selected as one of the International Olympic Committee Young Leaders for 2025, and she hopes to make a positive impact on inclusion for the LGBTQI+ community.

title.children: How International Olympic Committee Young Leader will improve inclusion in sport

image.altText: Tayla and her sister Rebecca Spies standing next to eachother infront of a payphone.

props.synopsis: A family friend of Tayla Spies posts a $5,000 reward for information leading to the missing mum's discovery as police remain stumped by the disappearance.

title.children: Private donor puts up $5,000 to find Tayla Spies

image.altText: A little girl in a bright blue jumper smiles with her mum who wears a bright pink jumper

props.synopsis: The proportion of only-child families has doubled since the 1980s but negative stereotypes about only children persist â despite them being based on flawed research from the late 1880s.

title.children: 'Sitting around waiting for you to die': The ethics of inheritance
